results.title: The Galapagos: Darwin's clues
results.brief_description: Shows how the variety and characteristics of the wildlife of the Galapagos Islands provided the first clues for Darwin’s theory of natural selection.

results.title: The Gadfly
results.creator_credit: Lewis Fitz-Gerald, Bill Bennett and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Starring John Derum, this is a dramatised documentary about Francis James, one of Australia’s most intriguing post WWII figures. He was imprisoned in China for three years in 1969 as a spy. His release was eventually secured with the help of his old school friend, Gough Whitlam. There is still some doubt as to why he was incarcerated in China. It may be he was a spy. Or perhaps he was merely trying to ressurect a shattered journalistic reputation after published photographs he claimed were Chinese misssile sites proved to be fake. This is the story of a journalist, theologina, prankster and Walter Mitty character, a man who dressed in a cape, wore a black broad brimmed hat, wrote copy for a newspaper out of the back of an old Rolls Royce, a man who told wild exaggerated stories and quoted Keats and Plato, a man from another age.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lewis Fitz-Gerald, Bill Bennett and Film Australia

results.title: The Future that Was
results.creator_credit: David Richardson, Lorna Pegram, BBC-TV, RM Productions and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Shock of the New Series”.
Part 8 of an 8-part series which presents a social history of the impact and development of the visual arts in the 20th century. In this episode, art critic, Robert Hughes discusses the future of modern art. He examines how modern art has gradually lost its sense of newness and possibility, and how the avant-garde has become a dying form. The program explores the influences museums, investment and media have had on the general public’s response to modern art.

results.title: The Future of alternative technology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Made Futures, Design and Technology”.
Defines “alternative” energy and technology and discusses the viability of this technology in technical and economic terms. Raises questions of whether alternative technology can be a major contributor in the production and consumption of energy.

results.title: The Furious flycycle
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: Melvin Spitznagel is a mechanical genius. When Professor Mickimecki, the inventor moves to town, Melvin “borrows” the professor’s anti-gravity pellet and converts his bicycle to a flying marvel, just in time to perform a heroic rescue. Animation by John Lange, Barry Whitebrook, Al Wilzbach and Fred Crippen. With music by Larry Wolff, this film is based on the book by Jan Wahl.

constellations_other.name: Processing grief through art
constellations_other.description: Thor: Love and Thunder begins with Thor meditating in a robe designed by Gumbaynggirr/Bundjalung artist Otis Hope Carey, best known for Ngalunggirr miinggi (healing spirit) (2020), a painting that expresses his grief over the loss of grandmother. Many artists process grief through their creative work.

results.title: The Fundamentals of tennis
results.brief_description: Donald Budge demonstrates forehand, backhand, service, volley and half-volley; the strokes are analysed and helpful suggestions for their proper execution are made. The film was sponsored by the USA Lawn Tennis Association.

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture photography using the written word in an analogy with the completed film: how a succession of single frames, equivalent of a letter in a single word, gives an impression of continuous movement; the definition and examples of a “shot” likening it to a word in a sentence; then the “sequence” equivalent of a paragraph or chapter, depending on length. The purpose terms used and results achieved when camera angles are varied and the camera moved, and the effect of varying the time scale. How to make basic transitions (cut, fade, mix) from shot to shot.
